question: Agbeti was once an enthusiastic preacher of the gospel and a defender of authority. However, he suddenly withdrew from these roles, becoming taciturn and embittered. He began to criticize religious and political leaders, as well as social crusaders, accusing them of hypocrisy and deceit. When emissaries tried to persuade him to support various policies, he refused, stating he would only cooperate if leaders provided sincere answers to his questions. Agbeti accused leaders of failing to practice what they preach, labeling them as fraudulent, treacherous, and hypocritical. He argued that the violence and unemotional disposition in society were due to leaders violating the tenets they expected others to uphold. In his final stance, he asserted that citizens should not be expected to follow principles that leaders themselves do not adhere to. What was Agbeti's initial attitude towards the gospel and authority?

Agbeti was once an enthusiastic preacher of the gospel and a defender of authority. However, he suddenly withdrew from these roles, becoming taciturn and embittered. He began to criticize religious and political leaders, as well as social crusaders, accusing them of hypocrisy and deceit. When emissaries tried to persuade him to support various policies, he refused, stating he would only cooperate if leaders provided sincere answers to his questions. Agbeti accused leaders of failing to practice what they preach, labeling them as fraudulent, treacherous, and hypocritical. He argued that the violence and unemotional disposition in society were due to leaders violating the tenets they expected others to uphold. In his final stance, he asserted that citizens should not be expected to follow principles that leaders themselves do not adhere to. How did Agbeti's behavior change suddenly?
option2: He withdrew into himself and became taciturn
